numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that the estimated legacy boost is much higher for the top 0.1% of families.
2. The top 0.1% of families are 7 times as likely to be admitted as other families.
3. I notice that the upper middle class has a lower than average admission rate.
4. The upper middle class has an income rank from 75 to 90.
5. The admission rate tends to be higher than average for poorer families.
6. The admission rate tends to be higher than average for richer families.
7. I wonder when admission rates became much higher for legacy students.
8. I wonder whether this trend started when admissions became more selective.
9. I wonder why the upper middle class is disadvantaged in college admissions.
10. I wonder whether anything is being done to mitigate the legacy boost.
11. I wonder whether the top 0.1% of families fare better because they have more money.
12. I wonder whether the top 0.1% of families invest more money in extracurricular activities.
13. I wonder whether the top 0.1% of families invest more money in tutoring.
14. This situation relates to me and my community.
15. I will enter college soon.
16. My classmates will compete against legacy students.
17. I will compete against legacy students.
18. Legacy students have a much higher likelihood of getting into selective schools.
19. This situation may hurt our chances of admission.
20. The graph shows disparate admission rates at elite colleges.
21. The graph shows admission rates for legacy students.
22. The graph shows admission rates for nonlegacy students.
23. The graph shows admission rates for rich families.
24. The graph shows admission rates for poor families.
25. The title is "The Golden Touch: College Admissions".
